alert.note: Alert for La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 2:36AM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 80 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest, southwest and west central Colorado and east central and southeast Utah. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially on ridge tops and mountain passes. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Tavaputs Plateau
